interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Unusuals: The Complete Series
Review Date: 2013/01/14
Store: Amber Tamblyn  (Actor),     Jeremy Renner  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Amber Tamblyn (TV’s “Joan of Arcadia”) and Jeremy Renner (THE HURT LOCKER) star as Detective Casey Shraeger and Detective Jason Walsh in this dark and gritty series that explores both the grounded drama and comic insanity of the world of New York City police detectives. Together, the two must investigate the murder of a cop, unraveling the conflicting clues that they hope will lead to the killer and ultimately reveal the truth behind the dead cop’s past. Also stars Harold Perrineau (TV’s“Lost”) as Detective Banks and Adam Goldberg (TV’s“Entourage”) as Detective Delahoy.', 'Amazon.com', 'Stills from', 'The Unusuals', '(Click for larger image)']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Monique Curnen, Terry Kinney, Jeremy Renner, Kai Lennox, Harold Perrineau, Adam Goldberg, Joshua Close, Amber TamblynMonique Curnen, Terry Kinney, Jeremy Renner, Kai Lennox, Harold Perrineau, Adam Goldberg, Joshua Close, Amber Tamblyn  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 3.18 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '7 hours and 12 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 6, 2010', 'Actors': 'Amber Tamblyn, Jeremy Renner, Harold Perrineau, Adam Goldberg, Terry Kinney', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: I had heard of this series when it came out, but I never got to watch it. There's a bunch of hilarious irony & smart-aleck comments to make you think this group of detectives have been together for a long time. They make this work. The one piece I found to be quite ironic & funny was in the pilot episode, Jeremy Renner's character made a smart-aleck comment to a lady that "this isn't a Bourne movie," then a few years later he starred in "The Bourne Legacy."
Review Title: Series is hilarious
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

I had heard of this series when it came out, but I never got to watch it. There's a bunch of hilarious irony & smart-aleck comments to make you think this group of detectives have been together for a long time. They make this work. The one piece I found to be quite ironic & funny was in the pilot episode, Jeremy Renner's character made a smart-aleck comment to a lady that "this isn't a Bourne movie," then a few years later he starred in "The Bourne Legacy."
Series is hilarious
profile: The user has a strong preference for gritty dramas with a blend of humor, particularly those that involve police work or detective narratives. They appreciate clever writing and irony, as evidenced by their enjoyment of the interplay between characters and the use of smart-aleck comments. This inclination suggests they seek out content that offers both entertainment and depth, allowing for thoughtful and engaging viewing experiences. The user also values well-developed characters and likely enjoys stories that combine serious themes with lighthearted moments. Their high rating indicates a tendency to enthusiastically endorse shows that resonate with their sensibilities, showcasing a distinct preference for series that have a cult following or unique storytelling elements outside mainstream offerings. Overall, the user shows a pattern of favoring shows that not only entertain but also provoke thought and laughter.
